item.title: China sell-off sparks flight from risk
item.description: Equity markets fell sharply after demand fears in China triggered one of the country’s largest one-day declines on record

item.title: Afghans fear poll attacks
item.description: Afghanistan’s top security officials yesterday warned they were unable to guarantee the security of this week’s elections, despite efforts to buy off a ceasefire from off Taliban insurgents.

item.title: Lowe’s quarterly profits fall 19%
item.description: Lowe’s, US home improvement retailer, reported that its second quarter profits fell by 19.1 per cent as consumers continued to delay house projects while uncertainty remains in the fragile market

item.title: Obama concedes healthcare insurance measure
item.description: US healthcare reform could proceed without a government-run insurance scheme, the Obama administration is ever more frequently acknowledging, a decision that would win over some conservatives but disappoint many liberals

item.title: Japan emerges from recession
item.description: Japan’s economy grew 0.9 per cent in the three months to June, marking the first expansion in five quarters on the back of exports and government stimulus spending

item.title: N Korea strikes deal with South
item.description: North Korea has struck a deal to revive South Korean tourism and factory investment in its territory, seeking hard currency while under increasingly effective UN sanctions

item.title: Deadline looms for Guaranty bids
item.description: At least one private equity consortium is considering a bid for Texas bank Guaranty Financial as the deadline for prospective buyers nears

item.title: Iran to let women join cabinet
item.description: Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad, Iran’s president, said he would nominate at least three female ministers to his cabinet, reaching out to the women who have been particularly active in post-election protests against his government

item.title: China saves face with cheaper iron ore deal
item.description: China has announced a six-month iron ore supply contract with Australia’s Fortescue at a price lower than those offered by the world’s top iron ore producers

item.title: European business trails US and UK
item.description: Companies from the eurozone are the only ones, among the trio of regions, where there have been more disappointments than positive surprises in the ongoing second-quarter results season
